  16. [@@@ocaml.warning "-40"]

  18. (* To assign numbers to globals and primitives *)

  20. open Misc
  21. open Asttypes
  22. open Lambda
  23. open Cmo_format

  25. module String = Misc.Stdlib.String

  27. (* Functions for batch linking *)

  29. ‌type error =
  30.     Undefined_global of string
  31.   | Unavailable_primitive of string
  32.   | Wrong_vm of string
  33.   | Uninitialized_global of string

  35. exception Error of error

  37. module Num_tbl (M : Map.S) = struct

  39. ‌  type t = {
  40.     cnt: int; (* The next number *)
  41.     tbl: int M.t ; (* The table of already numbered objects *)
  42.   }

  44. ‌  let empty = { cnt = 0; tbl = M.empty }

  46. ‌  let find nt key =
  47.     M.find key nt.tbl

  49. ‌  let enter nt key =
  50.     let n = !nt.cnt in
  51.     nt := { cnt = n + 1; tbl = M.add key n !nt.tbl };
  52.     n

  54. ‌  let incr nt =
  55.     let n = !nt.cnt in
  56.     nt := { cnt = n + 1; tbl = !nt.tbl };
  57.     n

  59. end
  60. module GlobalMap = Num_tbl(Ident.Map)
  61. module PrimMap = Num_tbl(Misc.Stdlib.String.Map)

  63. (* Global variables *)

  65. ‌let global_table = ref GlobalMap.empty
  66. and literal_table = ref([] : (int * Obj.t) list)

  68. ‌let is_global_defined id =
  69.   Ident.Map.mem id (!global_table).tbl

  71. ‌let slot_for_getglobal id =
  72.   try
  73.     GlobalMap.find !global_table id
  74.   with Not_found ->
  75.     raise(Error(Undefined_global(Ident.name id)))

  77. ‌let slot_for_setglobal id =
  78.   GlobalMap.enter global_table id

  80. ‌let slot_for_literal cst =
  81.   let n = GlobalMap.incr global_table in
  82.   literal_table := (n, cst) :: !literal_table;
  83.   n

  85. (* The C primitives *)

  87. ‌let c_prim_table = ref PrimMap.empty

  89. ‌let set_prim_table name =
  90.   ignore(PrimMap.enter c_prim_table name)

  92. ‌let of_prim name =
  93.   try
  94.     PrimMap.find !c_prim_table name
  95.   with Not_found ->
  96.     if !Clflags.custom_runtime || Config.host <> Config.target
  97.        || !Clflags.no_check_prims
  98.     then
  99.       PrimMap.enter c_prim_table name
  100.     else begin
  101.       match Dll.find_primitive name with
  102.       | None -> raise(Error(Unavailable_primitive name))
  103.       | Some Prim_exists ->
  104.           PrimMap.enter c_prim_table name
  105.       | Some (Prim_loaded symb) ->
  106.           let num = PrimMap.enter c_prim_table name in
  107.           Dll.synchronize_primitive num symb;
  108.           num
  109.     end

  111. let require_primitive name =
  112.   if name.[0] <> '%' then ignore(of_prim name)

  114. ‌let all_primitives () =
  115.   let prim = Array.make !c_prim_table.cnt "" in
  116.   String.Map.iter (fun name number -> prim.(number) <- name) !c_prim_table.tbl;
  117.   prim

  119. let data_primitive_names () =
  120.   all_primitives()
  121.   |> Array.to_list
  122.   |> concat_null_terminated

  124. let output_primitive_names outchan =
  125.   output_string outchan (data_primitive_names())

  127. open Printf

  129. let output_primitive_table outchan =
  130.   let prim = all_primitives() in
  131.   for i = 0 to Array.length prim - 1 do
  132.     fprintf outchan "extern value %s(void);\n" prim.(i)
  133.   done;
  134.   fprintf outchan "typedef value (*c_primitive)(void);\n";
  135.   fprintf outchan "const c_primitive caml_builtin_cprim[] = {\n";
  136.   for i = 0 to Array.length prim - 1 do
  137.     fprintf outchan "  %s,\n" prim.(i)
  138.   done;
  139.   fprintf outchan "  0 };\n";
  140.   fprintf outchan "const char * const caml_names_of_builtin_cprim[] = {\n";
  141.   for i = 0 to Array.length prim - 1 do
  142.     fprintf outchan "  \"%s\",\n" prim.(i)
  143.   done;
  144.   fprintf outchan "  0 };\n"

  146. (* Translate structured constants *)

  148. ‌let rec transl_const = function
  149.     Const_base(Const_int i) -> Obj.repr i
  150.   | Const_base(Const_char c) -> Obj.repr c
  151.   | Const_base(Const_string (s, _, _)) -> Obj.repr s
  152.   | Const_base(Const_float f) -> Obj.repr (float_of_string f)
  153.   | Const_base(Const_int32 i) -> Obj.repr i
  154.   | Const_base(Const_int64 i) -> Obj.repr i
  155.   | Const_base(Const_nativeint i) -> Obj.repr i
  156.   | Const_immstring s -> Obj.repr s
  157.   | Const_block(tag, fields) ->
  158.       let block = Obj.new_block tag (List.length fields) in
  159.       let transl_field pos cst =
  160.         Obj.set_field block pos (transl_const cst)
  161.       in
  162.       List.iteri transl_field fields;
  163.       block
  164.   | Const_float_array fields ->
  165.       let res = Array.Floatarray.create (List.length fields) in
  166.       List.iteri (fun i f -> Array.Floatarray.set res i (float_of_string f))
  167.         fields;
  168.       Obj.repr res

  170. (* Initialization for batch linking *)

  172. let init () =
  173.   (* Enter the predefined exceptions *)
  174.   Array.iteri
  175.     (fun i name ->
  176.       let id =
  177.         try List.assoc name Predef.builtin_values
  178.         with Not_found -> fatal_error "Symtable.init" in
  179.       let c = slot_for_setglobal id in
  180.       let cst = Const_block
  181.           (Obj.object_tag,
  182.            [Const_base(Const_string (name, Location.none,None));
  183.             Const_base(Const_int (-i-1))
  184.            ])
  185.       in
  186.       literal_table := (c, transl_const cst) :: !literal_table)
  187.     Runtimedef.builtin_exceptions;
  188.   (* Initialize the known C primitives *)
  189.   let set_prim_table_from_file primfile =
  190.     let ic = open_in primfile in
  191.     Misc.try_finally
  192.       ~always:(fun () -> close_in ic)
  193.       (fun () ->
  194.          try
  195.            while true do
  196.              set_prim_table (input_line ic)
  197.            done
  198.          with End_of_file -> ()
  199.       )
  200.   in
  201.   if String.length !Clflags.use_prims > 0 then
  202.     set_prim_table_from_file !Clflags.use_prims
  203.   else if String.length !Clflags.use_runtime > 0 then begin
  204. ‌    let primfile = Filename.temp_file "camlprims" "" in
  205.     Misc.try_finally
  206.       ~always:(fun () -> remove_file primfile)
  207.       (fun () ->
  208. ‌         let cmd =
  209.            Filename.quote_command
  210.              !Clflags.use_runtime
  211.              ~stdout:primfile
  212.              ["-p"]
  213.          in
  214.          if Sys.command cmd <> 0
  215.          then raise(Error(Wrong_vm !Clflags.use_runtime));
  216.          set_prim_table_from_file primfile
  217.       )
  218.   end else begin
  219.     Array.iter set_prim_table Runtimedef.builtin_primitives
  220.   end

  222. (* Relocate a block of object bytecode *)

  224. ‌let patch_int buff pos n =
  225.   LongString.set buff pos (Char.unsafe_chr n);
  226.   LongString.set buff (pos + 1) (Char.unsafe_chr (n asr 8));
  227.   LongString.set buff (pos + 2) (Char.unsafe_chr (n asr 16));
  228.   LongString.set buff (pos + 3) (Char.unsafe_chr (n asr 24))

  230. ‌let patch_object buff patchlist =
  231.   List.iter
  232.     (function
  233.         (Reloc_literal sc, pos) ->
  234.           patch_int buff pos (slot_for_literal sc)
  235.       | (Reloc_getglobal id, pos) ->
  236.           patch_int buff pos (slot_for_getglobal id)
  237.       | (Reloc_setglobal id, pos) ->
  238.           patch_int buff pos (slot_for_setglobal id)
  239.       | (Reloc_primitive name, pos) ->
  240.           patch_int buff pos (of_prim name))
  241.     patchlist

  243. (* Build the initial table of globals *)

  245. let initial_global_table () =
  246.   let glob = Array.make !global_table.cnt (Obj.repr 0) in
  247.   List.iter
  248.     (fun (slot, cst) -> glob.(slot) <- cst)
  249.     !literal_table;
  250.   literal_table := [];
  251.   glob

  253. (* Save the table of globals *)

  255. ‌let output_global_map oc =
  256.   output_value oc !global_table

  258. ‌let data_global_map () =
  259.   Obj.repr !global_table

  261. (* Functions for toplevel use *)

  263. (* Update the in-core table of globals *)

  265. ‌let update_global_table () =
  266.   let ng = !global_table.cnt in
  267.   if ng > Array.length(Meta.global_data()) then Meta.realloc_global_data ng;
  268.   let glob = Meta.global_data() in
  269.   List.iter
  270.     (fun (slot, cst) -> glob.(slot) <- cst)
  271.     !literal_table;
  272.   literal_table := []

  274. (* Recover data for toplevel initialization.  Data can come either from
  275.    executable file (normal case) or from linked-in data (-output-obj). *)

  277. type section_reader = {
  278.   read_string: Bytesections.Name.t -> string;
  279.   read_struct: Bytesections.Name.t -> Obj.t;
  280.   close_reader: unit -> unit
  281. }

  283. let read_sections () =
  284.   try
  285.     let sections =
  286.       List.map
  287.         (fun (n,o) -> Bytesections.Name.of_string n, o)
  288.         (Meta.get_section_table ())
  289.     in
  290.     { read_string =
  291.         (fun name ->
  292.            (Obj.magic(List.assoc name sections) : string));
  293.       read_struct =
  294.         (fun name -> List.assoc name sections);
  295.       close_reader =
  296.         (fun () -> ()) }
  297.   with Not_found ->
  298. ‌    let ic = open_in_bin Sys.executable_name in
  299. ‌    let section_table = Bytesections.read_toc ic in
  300.     { read_string = Bytesections.read_section_string section_table ic;
  301.       read_struct = Bytesections.read_section_struct section_table ic;
  302.       close_reader = fun () -> close_in ic }

  304. (* Initialize the linker for toplevel use *)

  306. ‌let init_toplevel () =
  307.   try
  308.     let sect = read_sections () in
  309.     (* Locations of globals *)
  310.     global_table :=
  311.       (Obj.magic (sect.read_struct Bytesections.Name.SYMB) : GlobalMap.t);
  312.     (* Primitives *)
  313.     let prims =
  314.       Misc.split_null_terminated (sect.read_string Bytesections.Name.PRIM) in
  315.     c_prim_table := PrimMap.empty;
  316.     List.iter set_prim_table prims;
  317.     (* DLL initialization *)
  318.     let dllpaths =
  319.       try Misc.split_null_terminated (sect.read_string Bytesections.Name.DLPT)
  320.       with Not_found -> [] in
  321.     Dll.init_toplevel dllpaths;
  322.     (* Recover CRC infos for interfaces *)
  323.     let crcintfs =
  324.       try
  325.         (Obj.magic (sect.read_struct Bytesections.Name.CRCS)
  326.          : (string * Digest.t option) list)
  327.       with Not_found -> [] in
  328.     (* Done *)
  329.     sect.close_reader();
  330.     crcintfs
  331.   with Bytesections.Bad_magic_number | Not_found | Failure _ ->
  332.     fatal_error "Toplevel bytecode executable is corrupted"

  334. (* Find the value of a global identifier *)

  336. ‌let get_global_position id = slot_for_getglobal id

  338. ‌let get_global_value id =
  339.   (Meta.global_data()).(slot_for_getglobal id)
  340. ‌let assign_global_value id v =
  341.   (Meta.global_data()).(slot_for_getglobal id) <- v

  343. (* Check that all globals referenced in the given patch list
  344.    have been initialized already *)

  346. ‌let defined_globals patchlist =
  347.   List.fold_left (fun accu rel ->
  348.       match rel with
  349.       | (Reloc_setglobal id, _pos) -> id :: accu
  350.       | _ -> accu)
  351.     []
  352.     patchlist

  354. let required_globals patchlist =
  355.   let is_compunit id = not (Ident.is_predef id) in
  356.   List.fold_left (fun accu rel ->
  357.       match rel with
  358.       | (Reloc_getglobal id, _pos) when (is_compunit id) -> id :: accu
  359.       | _ -> accu)
  360.     []
  361.     patchlist

  363. ‌let check_global_initialized patchlist =
  364.   (* First determine the globals we will define *)
  365.   let defined_globals = defined_globals patchlist in
  366.   (* Then check that all referenced, not defined globals have a value *)
  367.   let check_reference = function
  368.       (Reloc_getglobal id, _pos) ->
  369.         if not (List.mem id defined_globals)
  370.         && Obj.is_int (get_global_value id)
  371.         then raise (Error(Uninitialized_global(Ident.name id)))
  372.     | _ -> () in
  373.   List.iter check_reference patchlist

  375. (* Save and restore the current state *)

  377. ‌type global_map = GlobalMap.t

  379. ‌let current_state () = !global_table

  381. ‌let restore_state st = global_table := st

  383. ‌let hide_additions (st : global_map) =
  384.   if st.cnt > !global_table.cnt then
  385.     fatal_error "Symtable.hide_additions";
  386.   global_table :=
  387.     {GlobalMap.
  388.       cnt = !global_table.cnt;
  389.       tbl = st.tbl }

  391. (* "Filter" the global map according to some predicate.
  392.    Used to expunge the global map for the toplevel. *)

  394. ‌let filter_global_map p (gmap : global_map) =
  395.   let newtbl = ref Ident.Map.empty in
  396.   Ident.Map.iter
  397.     (fun id num -> if p id then newtbl := Ident.Map.add id num !newtbl)
  398.     gmap.tbl;
  399.   {GlobalMap. cnt = gmap.cnt; tbl = !newtbl}

  401. ‌let iter_global_map f (gmap : global_map) =
  402.   Ident.Map.iter f gmap.tbl

  404. ‌let is_defined_in_global_map (gmap : global_map) id =
  405.   Ident.Map.mem id gmap.tbl

  407. ‌let empty_global_map = GlobalMap.empty

  409. (* Error report *)

  411. open Format

  413. ‌let report_error ppf = function
  414.   | Undefined_global s ->
  415.       fprintf ppf "Reference to undefined global `%s'" s
  416.   | Unavailable_primitive s ->
  417.       fprintf ppf "The external function `%s' is not available" s
  418.   | Wrong_vm s ->
  419.       fprintf ppf "Cannot find or execute the runtime system %s" s
  420.   | Uninitialized_global s ->
  421.       fprintf ppf "The value of the global `%s' is not yet computed" s

  423. let () =
  424.   Location.register_error_of_exn
  425.     (function
  426.       | Error err -> Some (Location.error_of_printer_file report_error err)
  427.       | _ -> None
  428.     )

  430. ‌let reset () =
  431.   global_table := GlobalMap.empty;
  432.   literal_table := [];
  433.   c_prim_table := PrimMap.empty
